title: 11 Nordstrom Fashion Bestsellers to Buy Before They're Gone
description: As shopping editors, we know all of the most useful secrets when it comes to searching through Nordstrom's site for the best styles (and even better deals). In many ways, it's our job to track down great products with high ratings, and Nordstrom has no shortage of those. If you find yourself in the market to update your closet with a new clothing item or even a top-rated pair of shoes, we have more than a few suggestions. We've curated products that are not only trending, but included in our own personal favorites as well. Below, we've laid them all out for you - because, after all, what are shopping fairy godmothers for? Nordstrom recently released tons of new wardrobe essentials that are sure to sell out quickly, plus a few cult-favorite pieces that are hard enough to find in stock. From a top-rated cardigan to stylish Madewell wide-leg jeans and editor-loved Birkenstock clogs, these pieces are designed to live in your closet for the longterm - even as they endure multiple trend changes and TikTok aesthetics. Check out the best Nordstrom clothes that customers are currently loving from the retailer ahead, and buy them before they sell out.
author: Kyley Warren
excerpt: Here's what's trending at Nordstrom this season.
text: While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.As shopping editors, we know all of the most useful secrets when it comes to searching through Nordstrom's site for the best styles (and even better deals). In many ways, it's our job to track down great products with high ratings, and Nordstrom has no shortage of those. If you find yourself in the market to update your closet with a new clothing item or even a top-rated pair of shoes, we have more than a few suggestions. We've curated products that are not only trending, but included in our own personal favorites as well. Below, we've laid them all out for you — because, after all, what are shopping fairy godmothers for? Nordstrom recently released tons of new wardrobe essentials that are sure to sell out quickly, plus a few cult-favorite pieces that are hard enough to find in stock. From a top-rated cardigan to stylish Madewell wide-leg jeans and editor-loved Birkenstock clogs, these pieces are designed to live in your closet for the longterm — even as they endure multiple trend changes and TikTok aesthetics. Check out the best Nordstrom clothes that customers are currently loving from the retailer ahead, and buy them before they sell out.nordstrom.comBest Workout LeggingsZella Live In High Waist Leggings ($44-$59, originally $59) Ready to jump back on the fitness bandwagon? You'll feel even more empowered to kickstart your athletic goals with the help of a great pair of leggings — just like these best-selling Zella leggings from Nordstrom. The high, slip-proof waistband includes a pocket. Whether you're going for a run or just running errands, these leggings will ensure you do it comfortably.nordstrom.comBest V-Neck SweaterNordstrom Wool Blend V-Neck Sweater ($45, originally $100) Made from an ultra-soft wool blend, this sweater features a relaxed, slightly slouchy silhouette with drop shoulders—elevated by a flattering V-neckline that adds just the right touch of polish.nordstrom.comBest CardiganCaslon Crewneck Cardigan ($60) A lightweight cardigan is a layering essential for winter. This one features a timeless style that's fitted enough to fit under a blazer and comes in three different colors. nordstrom.comBest Oversize BlazerTopshop Split Back Oversize Blazer ($77, originally $119) The oversize blazer trend is holding steadfast and now is the perfect time to throw it on top of everything from turtlenecks to blouses. Slightly stretchy with notched lapels and front flap pockets, it's a layering essential you'll have for years to come — not to mention a steal now that it's discounted for less than $100.PS Photography | Angela EliasBest Wide-Leg DenimEmmett Patch Pocket Wide Leg Jeans ($138) Wide-leg denim is everywhere right now, but it's hard to find a pair that's flattering, comfortable, and classic enough to last. This Madewell style features retro-inspired front patch pockets, a high, stretchy waist, and a wide leg that manages to meet the trend without looking sloppy. Our editor tested them out and gives her honest opinion in this Madewell Emmett Patch Pocket Wide Leg Jeans review. Editor quote: "The material is mostly cotton with a smidge of recycled polyester and elastane, so they feel especially soft and stretchy. The top of the jeans hit just above my belly button and almost feel like shapewear. As a mom of two, I prefer high-waisted jeans that offer plenty of belly support without feeling like I'm counting down the minutes until I can unbutton them. They mold to my curves and I can squat, bend over, and run around all day without the dreaded droopiness that sometimes happens towards the end of the day." — Angela Elias, contributing editor, ShoppingBest Knee-High BootsSam Edelman Sylvia Knee High Boot ($140-$250, originally $200-$250) Sexy and elegant, we're picturing wearing these knee-high boots with everything from dresses and skirts to barrel-leg pants. They come in seven different leather options, as well as this gorgeous black suede style.PS Photography | Angela EliasBest Barrel-Leg JeansMadewell The Darted Barrel Leg Jeans ($148) If you've been searching for a subtle pair of barrel leg jeans that aren't too voluminous, Madewell's The darted Barrel Leg Jeans could be the perfect option. The jeans feature darts that are angled to enhance the curve-shape without needing to exaggerate the volume. Our editor tested them out and shares her thoughts in this Madewell The Darted Barrel Leg Jeans review. Editor quote: "These jeans have a fitted waist, bow out around the middle of the leg, and have a tapered ankle. While there's enough mid-leg volume to capture the barrel leg look, it isn't as exaggerated as Free People's version, or a lot of others on the market. To help emphasize the curved leg shape, this pair has darts at the knees to create a sort of optical illusion, instead of tacking on more volume. The result is subtle and surprisingly flattering." — AEnordstrom.comBest SneakersVeja Campo Sneaker ($160) For a French girl twist on a sporty look, you can't go wrong with a pair of Veja sneakers. Their clean look is accented with a bold and colorful "V" and they look equally chic with jeans and dresses. You can grab them in eight different colors, but we love the fresh pop of Kelly green.PS Photography | Angela EliasBest Winter-Friendly ClogsBirkenstock Boston Genuine Shearling Lined Clog ($175) While Birkenstock's Boston Soft Footbed Clog is a go-to for spring and summer, this shearling-lined version is especially cozy for fall and winter. They can be worn with everything from sweatsuits to jeans and practically feel like house slippers. Our editor owns them and adores them. For more details, check out her Birkenstock Boston Genuine Shearling Lined Clog review. Editor quote: "They feel like a fuzzy slipper but have the ergonomic design and comfortable yet sturdy footbed that Birkenstock's Boston clogs are known for. I was initially worried that the shearling lining might make my feet sweat, but unlike synthetic versions, genuine shearling is naturally temperature-regulating. On warmer days or when I quickly need to slip into something, I've worn them barefoot, but they also manage to look cool with a quarter sock on chillier days." — AE- — Additional reporting by Angela Elias and Balim TezelKyley Warren (she/her) is an award-winning writer and editor with more than four years of experience in the publishing space. She previously worked as an assistant editor on PS Shopping and is an expert on all things related to shopping and fashion. Before joining PS, Kyley worked with Entertainment Tonight as a style commerce writer, and her byline has appeared in publications globally.Angela Elias (she/her) is a contributing editor for PS Shopping, where she reviews everything from beauty products to kitchen gadgets, curates can't-miss sales, and creates "best of" shopping roundups. In her former roles at PS, she led the relaunch of its Latine identity and family-focused verticals, directed its Home vertical, and hosted shopping segments. She has nearly 15 years of experience working in the lifestyle space as a writer, editor, content strategist, director, on-camera talent, and publicist.Balim Tezel (she/her) is a shopping updates editor at PS and the founder of Maison des Nus, a New York-based affordable luxury brand. She graduated from Northwestern University's Medill School of Journalism.
html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

As shopping editors, we know all of the most useful secrets when it comes to searching through Nordstrom's site for the best styles (and even better deals). In many ways, it's our job to track down great products with high ratings, and Nordstrom has no shortage of those.

If you find yourself in the market to update your closet with a new clothing item or even a top-rated pair of shoes, we have more than a few suggestions. We've curated products that are not only trending, but included in our own personal favorites as well. Below, we've laid them all out for you — because, after all, what are shopping fairy godmothers for?

Nordstrom recently released tons of new wardrobe essentials that are sure to sell out quickly, plus a few cult-favorite pieces that are hard enough to find in stock. From a top-rated cardigan to stylish Madewell wide-leg jeans and editor-loved Birkenstock clogs, these pieces are designed to live in your closet for the longterm — even as they endure multiple trend changes and TikTok aesthetics.

Check out the best Nordstrom clothes that customers are currently loving from the retailer ahead, and buy them before they sell out.

Best Workout Leggings

Zella Live In High Waist Leggings ($44-$59, originally $59)

Ready to jump back on the fitness bandwagon? You'll feel even more empowered to kickstart your athletic goals with the help of a great pair of leggings — just like these best-selling Zella leggings from Nordstrom. The high, slip-proof waistband includes a pocket. Whether you're going for a run or just running errands, these leggings will ensure you do it comfortably.

Best V-Neck Sweater

Nordstrom Wool Blend V-Neck Sweater ($45, originally $100)

Made from an ultra-soft wool blend, this sweater features a relaxed, slightly slouchy silhouette with drop shoulders—elevated by a flattering V-neckline that adds just the right touch of polish.

Best Cardigan

Caslon Crewneck Cardigan ($60)

A lightweight cardigan is a layering essential for winter. This one features a timeless style that's fitted enough to fit under a blazer and comes in three different colors.

Best Oversize Blazer

Topshop Split Back Oversize Blazer ($77, originally $119)

The oversize blazer trend is holding steadfast and now is the perfect time to throw it on top of everything from turtlenecks to blouses. Slightly stretchy with notched lapels and front flap pockets, it's a layering essential you'll have for years to come — not to mention a steal now that it's discounted for less than $100.

Best Wide-Leg Denim

Emmett Patch Pocket Wide Leg Jeans ($138)

Wide-leg denim is everywhere right now, but it's hard to find a pair that's flattering, comfortable, and classic enough to last. This Madewell style features retro-inspired front patch pockets, a high, stretchy waist, and a wide leg that manages to meet the trend without looking sloppy. Our editor tested them out and gives her honest opinion in this Madewell Emmett Patch Pocket Wide Leg Jeans review.

Editor quote: "The material is mostly cotton with a smidge of recycled polyester and elastane, so they feel especially soft and stretchy. The top of the jeans hit just above my belly button and almost feel like shapewear. As a mom of two, I prefer high-waisted jeans that offer plenty of belly support without feeling like I'm counting down the minutes until I can unbutton them. They mold to my curves and I can squat, bend over, and run around all day without the dreaded droopiness that sometimes happens towards the end of the day." — Angela Elias, contributing editor, Shopping

Best Knee-High Boots

Sam Edelman Sylvia Knee High Boot ($140-$250, originally $200-$250)

Sexy and elegant, we're picturing wearing these knee-high boots with everything from dresses and skirts to barrel-leg pants. They come in seven different leather options, as well as this gorgeous black suede style.

Best Barrel-Leg Jeans

Madewell The Darted Barrel Leg Jeans ($148)

If you've been searching for a subtle pair of barrel leg jeans that aren't too voluminous, Madewell's The darted Barrel Leg Jeans could be the perfect option. The jeans feature darts that are angled to enhance the curve-shape without needing to exaggerate the volume. Our editor tested them out and shares her thoughts in this Madewell The Darted Barrel Leg Jeans review.

Editor quote: "These jeans have a fitted waist, bow out around the middle of the leg, and have a tapered ankle. While there's enough mid-leg volume to capture the barrel leg look, it isn't as exaggerated as Free People's version, or a lot of others on the market. To help emphasize the curved leg shape, this pair has darts at the knees to create a sort of optical illusion, instead of tacking on more volume. The result is subtle and surprisingly flattering." — AE

Best Sneakers

Veja Campo Sneaker ($160)

For a French girl twist on a sporty look, you can't go wrong with a pair of Veja sneakers. Their clean look is accented with a bold and colorful "V" and they look equally chic with jeans and dresses. You can grab them in eight different colors, but we love the fresh pop of Kelly green.

Best Winter-Friendly Clogs

Birkenstock Boston Genuine Shearling Lined Clog ($175)

While Birkenstock's Boston Soft Footbed Clog is a go-to for spring and summer, this shearling-lined version is especially cozy for fall and winter. They can be worn with everything from sweatsuits to jeans and practically feel like house slippers. Our editor owns them and adores them. For more details, check out her Birkenstock Boston Genuine Shearling Lined Clog review.

Editor quote: "They feel like a fuzzy slipper but have the ergonomic design and comfortable yet sturdy footbed that Birkenstock's Boston clogs are known for. I was initially worried that the shearling lining might make my feet sweat, but unlike synthetic versions, genuine shearling is naturally temperature-regulating. On warmer days or when I quickly need to slip into something, I've worn them barefoot, but they also manage to look cool with a quarter sock on chillier days." — AE

— Additional reporting by Angela Elias and Balim Tezel

Kyley Warren (she/her) is an award-winning writer and editor with more than four years of experience in the publishing space. She previously worked as an assistant editor on PS Shopping and is an expert on all things related to shopping and fashion. Before joining PS, Kyley worked with Entertainment Tonight as a style commerce writer, and her byline has appeared in publications globally.

Angela Elias (she/her) is a contributing editor for PS Shopping, where she reviews everything from beauty products to kitchen gadgets, curates can't-miss sales, and creates "best of" shopping roundups. In her former roles at PS, she led the relaunch of its Latine identity and family-focused verticals, directed its Home vertical, and hosted shopping segments. She has nearly 15 years of experience working in the lifestyle space as a writer, editor, content strategist, director, on-camera talent, and publicist.

Balim Tezel (she/her) is a shopping updates editor at PS and the founder of Maison des Nus, a New York-based affordable luxury brand. She graduated from Northwestern University's Medill School of Journalism.
